body:
# Crynamo

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/timkendall/crynamo.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/timkendall/crynamo)
[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/timkendall/crynamo.svg)](https://github.com/timkendall/crynamo/releases)


Crynamo is a simple interface to [Amazon's DynamoDB](https://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/) written in Crystal. Right now it is a fairly low-level wrapper that provides type marshalling between your Crystal program and DynamoDB.

- ✔️ Simple API with `get`, `put`, and `delete` support
- ✔️ DynamoDB type marshalling
- ✔️ Native exceptions for every AWS error
- ✔️ Non-blocking

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  crynamo:
    github: timkendall/crynamo
    version: ~> 0.1.1
```

## Usage

1. [Configuration](#Configuration)
1. [Client](#Client)

### Configuration

```crystal
require "crynamo"

config = Crynamo::Configuration.new(
  access_key_id: "aws-access-key",
  secret_access_key: "aws-secret-key",
  region: "us-east-1",
  endpoint: "http://localhost:8000",
)
dynamodb = Crynamo::Client.new(config)

```

### Client

Crynamo exposes `Crynamo::Client` as a basic DynamoDB client. The client's API is low-level and mimics the base [DynamoDB Low-Level HTTP API](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/Programming.LowLevelAPI.html).

```crystal
# Get an item
dynamodb.get!("pets", { name: "Doobie" })

# Insert an item
dynamodb.put!("pets", { name: "Thor", lifespan: 100 })

# Remove an item
dynamodb.delete!("pets", { name: "Doobie" })
```

## Development

1. Follow the instructions here to setup [Local DynamoDB](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/DynamoDBLocal.html)
1. Install Crystal deps with `shards install`
1. Use [icr](https://github.com/crystal-community/icr) to play with things

## Tip

It's useful to define a bash command for launching DynamoDB. Add this to your `.bash_profile` to start DynamoDB with a simple `dynamodb` command.

```bash
dynamodb() {
 cd /path/to/dynamodb
 java -Djava.library.path=./DynamoDBLocal_lib -jar DynamoDBLocal.jar -sharedDb
}
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it ( https://github.com/[your-github-name]/crynamo/fork )
2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [timkendall](https://github.com/timkendall)  - creator, maintainer

types.name: Exceptions
types.doc: Encapsulates errors specific to DynamoDB operations. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/APIReference/API_Operations_Amazon_DynamoDB.html for official documentation
types.summary: Encapsulates errors specific to DynamoDB operations.

types.name: ConditionalCheckFailedException
types.doc: Raised when a condition specified in the operation could not be evaluated.
types.summary: Raised when a condition specified in the operation could not be evaluated.

types.name: ItemCollectionSizeLimitExceededException
types.doc: Raised when an item collection is too large.
types.summary: Raised when an item collection is too large.

types.name: ProvisionedThroughputExceededException
types.doc: Raised when your request rate is too high.
types.summary: Raised when your request rate is too high.

types.name: ResourceNotFoundException
types.doc: Raised when the operation tried to access a nonexistent table or index. The resource might not be specified correctly, or its status might not be ACTIVE.
types.summary: Raised when the operation tried to access a nonexistent table or index.

types.name: Operation
types.doc: Represents the supported AWS DynamoDB operations (note: this is not exhaustive).
types.summary: Represents the supported AWS DynamoDB operations (note: this is not exhaustive).

types.name: TypeDescriptor
types.doc:
Represents a DynamoDB type descriptor
(see http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/APIReference/API_AttributeValue.html)
types.summary: Represents a DynamoDB type descriptor (see http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/APIReference/API_AttributeValue.html)

types.name: Error
types.doc: Represents an error returned from an AWS API
types.summary: Represents an error returned from an AWS API

def.name: to_json
def.body:
json.object do
  ___type = @__type
  if ___type.nil?
  else
    json.field("__type") do
      ___type.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _message = @message
  if _message.nil?
  else
    json.field("message") do
      _message.to_json(json)
    end
  end
end

types.name: Exceptions
types.doc:
Encapsulates the errors common to the API actions of all AWS services. (note: hopefully this can be moved to a dedicated Crystal AWS shard at some point).
See the official AWS documentation here https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/APIReference/CommonErrors.html
types.summary: Encapsulates the errors common to the API actions of all AWS services.

types.name: AccessDeniedException
types.doc: Raised when you do not have sufficient access to perform the action.
types.summary: Raised when you do not have sufficient access to perform the action.

types.name: IncompleteSignature
types.doc: Raised when request signature does not conform to AWS standards.
types.summary: Raised when request signature does not conform to AWS standards.

types.name: InternalFailure
types.doc: Raised when the request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception or failure.
types.summary: Raised when the request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception or failure.

types.name: InvalidAction
types.doc: Raised when the action or operation requested is invalid. Verify that the action is typed correctly.
types.summary: Raised when the action or operation requested is invalid.

types.name: InvalidClientTokenId
types.doc: Raised when the X.509 certificate or AWS access key ID provided does not exist in our records.
types.summary: Raised when the X.509 certificate or AWS access key ID provided does not exist in our records.

types.name: InvalidParameterCombination
types.doc: Raised when parameters that must not be used together were used together.
types.summary: Raised when parameters that must not be used together were used together.

types.name: InvalidParameterValue
types.doc: Raised when an invalid or out-of-range value was supplied for the input parameter.
types.summary: Raised when an invalid or out-of-range value was supplied for the input parameter.

types.name: InvalidQueryParameter
types.doc: Raised when the AWS query string is malformed or does not adhere to AWS standards.
types.summary: Raised when the AWS query string is malformed or does not adhere to AWS standards.

types.name: MalformedQueryString
types.doc: Raised when the query string contains a syntax error.
types.summary: Raised when the query string contains a syntax error.

types.name: MissingAction
types.doc: Raised when the request is missing an action or a required parameter.
types.summary: Raised when the request is missing an action or a required parameter.

types.name: MissingAuthenticationToken
types.doc: Raised when the request must contain either a valid (registered) AWS access key ID or X.509 certificate.
types.summary: Raised when the request must contain either a valid (registered) AWS access key ID or X.509 certificate.

types.name: MissingParameter
types.doc: Raised when a required parameter for the specified action is not supplied.
types.summary: Raised when a required parameter for the specified action is not supplied.

types.name: OptInRequired
types.doc: Raised when the AWS access key ID needs a subscription for the service.
types.summary: Raised when the AWS access key ID needs a subscription for the service.

types.name: RequestExpired
types.doc: Raised when the request reached the service more than 15 minutes after the date stamp on the request or more than 15 minutes after the request expiration date (such as for pre-signed URLs), or the date stamp on the request is more than 15 minutes in the future.
types.summary: Raised when the request reached the service more than 15 minutes after the date stamp on the request or more than 15 minutes after the request expiration date (such as for pre-signed URLs), or the date stamp on the request is more than 15 minutes in the future.

types.name: ServiceUnavailable
types.doc: Raised when the request has failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
types.summary: Raised when the request has failed due to a temporary failure of the server.

types.name: ThrottlingException
types.doc: Raised when the request was denied due to request throttling.
types.summary: Raised when the request was denied due to request throttling.

types.name: ValidationError
types.doc: Raised when the input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.
types.summary: Raised when the input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

types.name: Client
types.doc: A low-level interface for connecting to a DynamoDB cluster and interating with it.
types.summary: A low-level interface for connecting to a DynamoDB cluster and interating with it.

instance_methods.name: delete!
instance_methods.doc: Deletes an item at the specified key
instance_methods.summary: Deletes an item at the specified key

def.name: delete!
def.body:
marshalled = Crynamo::Marshaller.to_dynamo(key)
query = {TableName: table, Key: marshalled}
request(AWS::DynamoDB::Operation::DeleteItem, query)
return nil

def.name: get!
def.body:
marshalled = Crynamo::Marshaller.to_dynamo(key)
query = {TableName: table, Key: marshalled}
result = request(AWS::DynamoDB::Operation::GetItem, query)
if !((JSON.parse(result)).as_h.has_key?("Item"))
  return {} of String => JSON::Type
end
Crynamo::Marshaller.from_dynamo((JSON.parse(result))["Item"].as_h)

def.name: put!
def.body:
marshalled = Crynamo::Marshaller.to_dynamo(item)
query = {TableName: table, Item: marshalled}
request(AWS::DynamoDB::Operation::PutItem, query)
return nil

types.name: Configuration
types.doc: The necessary configuration needed for connecting to a DynamoDB cluster
types.summary: The necessary configuration needed for connecting to a DynamoDB cluster

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (access_key_id : String, secret_access_key : String, region : String, endpoint : String, api_version : String = "2012-08-10")

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(access_key_id, secret_access_key, region, endpoint, api_version)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: from_dynamo
instance_methods.doc:
Converts a DynamoDB `Hash` representation to a regular Crystal `Hash`
TODO Convert to a `NamedTuple` instead
instance_methods.summary: Converts a DynamoDB Hash representation to a regular Crystal Hash TODO Convert to a NamedTuple instead

def.name: from_dynamo
def.body:
keys = item.keys
crystal_values = item.values.map do |value|
  dynamodb_type = (value.as(Hash)).first_key
  dynamodb_value = (value.as(Hash)).first_value
  case dynamodb_type
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.string
    dynamodb_value
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.number
    (dynamodb_value.as(String)).to_f32
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.bool
    dynamodb_value.as(Bool)
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.string_set
    (dynamodb_value.as(Array)).map do |__arg0|
      __arg0.as(String)
    end
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.number_set
    (dynamodb_value.as(Array)).map do |__arg1|
      (__arg1.as(String)).to_f32
    end
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.list
    dynamodb_value.as(Array)
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.map
    dynamodb_value
  when DynamoDB::TypeDescriptor.null
    nil
  else
    raise(MarshallException.new("Couldn't marshal DynamoDB type #{typeof(dynamodb_type)} to Crystal type."))
  end
end
Hash.zip(keys, crystal_values)

instance_methods.name: to_dynamo
instance_methods.doc: Converts a `NamedTuple` to a DynamoDB `Hash` representation
